title: The Bachelorette: Why Angie Kent is set for heartbreak
text:
The Bachelorette's Ciarran Stott is an early favourite to win the show after a trailer showed Angie Kent swooning over his cheeky sense of humour.

But ahead of Wednesday night's premiere, Daily Mail Australia can reveal that Angie may be left heartbroken by the long-haired Englishman.

Despite making a good impression at the first cocktail party, Ciarran may have another reason for being on the show besides simply finding love.

Scroll down for video

Trouble ahead? The Bachelorette's Angie Kent may be left heartbroken by long-haired Englishman Ciarran Stott, after a source claimed he's only on the show to get back at his ex

A source claimed that Ciarran, 25, applied for the show because his ex-girlfriend Renee Barrett appeared on Matt Agnew's season of The Bachelor.

'As soon as he found out she'd been cast on Matt's season and was about to start filming, he decided to get on The Bachelorette,' said the insider.

'Casting producers were aware of this and it definitely helped his cause. His friends are saying he mostly went on to get back at Renee.'

Oh, no! According to a source, Ciarran only applied for the show because his ex-girlfriend Renee Barrett appeared on Matt Agnew's season of The Bachelor. Pictured: Angie Kent

Remember her? Sadly, Renee Barrett's journey on The Bachelor was short lived as she was one of the first women sent home by astrophysicist Matt Agnew

Renee and Ciarran, who both live in the Northern Territory, are understood to have split before either of them applied for the dating franchise.

Sadly, Renee's journey on The Bachelor was short lived as she was one of the first women sent home by astrophysicist Matt.

Meanwhile, Ciarran is believed to go far on The Bachelorette but sources say he doesn't win Angie's heart.

Bad boy alert! A Bachelorette trailer released on Thursday officially introduced Ciarran as one of Angie's 18 eligible suitors

It comes after a trailer released on Thursday officially introduced Ciarran as one of Angie's 18 eligible suitors.

Ciarran, who describes himself as 'fun, flirty, flamboyant and fabulously British', left her blushing on the red carpet with his cheeky sense of humour.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel 10 for comment.

The Bachelorette premieres Wednesday at 7:30pm on Channel 10
description: The Bachelorette's Ciarran Stott is an early favourite to win the show after a trailer showed Angie Kent swooning over his cheeky sense of humour.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
